instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1989: What is A1989? A1989 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2018, 2019 with EMC 3124, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00850..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Hi Guys.

I have this <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> that decided to stop powering on. The client said that the OS crashed during the backup of data and then it went into safe mode. They went to another shop and from that moment it stopped powering on. The laptop had some coffee(probably) spill near the trackpad area but they seem not to be aware of that. I measured all power lines I have <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, 3&5V from <CHIP>U7650</CHIP>, and all else besides CPU power. There's no short on the board measured with diode mode all looks fine. I have a suspicion that the T2 got corrupted but wanna advise first here before I try to recover it. Would appreciate any feedback, maybe I missed something :)

Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Update: Revive didn't work, so I had to restore it :) should be fine now thanks for the help
